inputs.task: Design and improve the LaunchBase homepage from first principles
inputs.whitePaper:
LaunchBase is an operating system for small businesses.
Not a website builder. Not another tool. Not a one-time agency project.

LaunchBase is ongoing ownership of a business's digital operating layer:
- website uptime + maintenance
- lead capture + forms
- monitoring + safety decisions
- updates + publishing cadence
- integrations + visibility
- logging + accountability

LaunchBase exists because most small businesses already have tools, but no one owns the system.
They have a website, a payment tool, a calendar, a Google profile, and logins…
…but the owner still carries the burden of making sure everything works.

LaunchBase sells relief from that cognitive load.

Core customer pain: The customer isn't buying a website. They're buying the ability to stop thinking about:
- "Is it still working?"
- "Did that form actually send?"
- "What should I post?"
- "Is anything broken?"
- "Am I missing something?"

This is background anxiety, not a feature gap.
The enemy is not "lack of tools."
The enemy is lack of ownership.

LaunchBase replaces the customer as the default system-checker.

Promise:
✅ Change is reversible
✅ Non-action is safe
✅ Silence is a valid decision
✅ Every action is logged
✅ Customer sees their real site before paying
✅ LaunchBase acts only after approval

The brand is accountability.
LaunchBase is responsibility-as-a-service.

Target customer:
- owner-operator
- service business
- small team
- not "tech obsessed"
- wants a business to run, not to "manage tools"

Tone: calm, competent, honest, operationally serious, safety-first, premium but not flashy.
This is a systems product, not a "creative brand party."

Design objective:
✅ Create instant trust
✅ Communicate the contract clearly
✅ Show the "safe-by-default" nature
✅ Make "Hand It Off" feel low-risk
✅ Explain observability in plain English
✅ Look premium enough to justify recurring ownership

currentCopy.hero: Stop carrying the system in your head. Hand it off. Keep visibility.
currentCopy.problem: No one owns the system. You're the fallback for everything.
currentCopy.solution: LaunchBase becomes the owner. You stay informed, not involved.
currentCopy.trust: Safe by default. Fully logged. Reversible.

inputs.audience: Owner-operators of service businesses (fitness studios, coffee shops, consulting firms) who want stability and accountability, not tool management
inputs.tone: Calm, minimal, trustworthy, premium. Avoid hype. Avoid 'AI magic.' Avoid exaggerated claims.
inputs.constraints: Mobile-first. Must feel like 'responsibility-as-a-service.' Must emphasize safety, reversibility, observability. Must reduce mental load while reading.

proposedChanges.value: Include a visual representation of the system hand-off process with icons or a flow diagram to enhance understanding above the fold.
proposedChanges.rationale: Visual elements can quickly convey complex processes, aiding clarity and engagement.
risks: Might clutter the hero section if not executed with a minimalist approach.

proposedChanges.value: Merge 'Problem' and 'Solution' sections into a two-column layout with 'Problem' on the left and 'Solution' on the right for direct comparison.
proposedChanges.rationale: Side-by-side comparison reduces cognitive load and clarifies the transition from problem to solution.
risks: Potentially reduces depth of content if not carefully managed.

proposedChanges.value: Add a sticky primary CTA button on the mobile layout that remains visible after 40% scroll to ensure easy access.
proposedChanges.rationale: Ensures the CTA is always accessible, improving conversion paths on mobile.
risks: Could be intrusive if not designed to blend with the UI.

proposedChanges.value: Convert pricing tables to card format with one card highlighted as the default tier; include bullet points for 'what you get' in each tier.
proposedChanges.rationale: Cards with clear highlights and features improve scannability and ease decision-making.
risks: Highlighting one tier might bias user choices.

proposedChanges.value: Introduce an audit trail component with a simple timeline or list format showcasing past actions.
proposedChanges.rationale: A visible audit trail reinforces transparency and trust, emphasizing the 'fully logged' promise.
risks: Requires careful design to avoid overwhelming users with information.

proposedChanges.value: Move the 'Trust' section above the 'Solution' section for enhanced emphasis on safety and accountability.
proposedChanges.rationale: Prioritizing trust can establish credibility early, supporting the decision to 'hand it off.'
risks: Reordering might disrupt the logical flow if not clearly connected.

proposedChanges.value: Simplify navigation to include only key sections: Home, Features, Pricing, Trust, Contact.
proposedChanges.rationale: Streamlined navigation reduces cognitive load and focuses user journey on essential information.
risks: May limit access to secondary information.

proposedChanges.value: Use 48px H1 (mobile: 32px) with line-height 1.1 for hero headline to create calm, confident tone
proposedChanges.rationale: A larger, more prominent hero headline will convey confidence and draw attention without overwhelming the user, aligning with the calm and premium tone.
risks: Potentially overwhelming on smaller screens if not adjusted

proposedChanges.rationale: Generous spacing will help to segment content clearly, conveying a sense of calm and orderliness that reduces cognitive load.
risks: May result in longer page length, affecting scrolling experience

proposedChanges.value: Use pill-shaped buttons with 16px padding, subtle shadow, no gradients
proposedChanges.rationale: Pill-shaped buttons with subtle shadows provide a premium and safe feel, reinforcing the brand's assurance and operational seriousness.
risks: May not stand out on very light backgrounds without careful color selection

proposedChanges.value: Set max text width to 65ch for body copy to improve readability
proposedChanges.rationale: Limiting line length will enhance readability, making it easier for users to consume information without feeling overwhelmed.
risks: May require adjustments for different screen sizes to maintain consistency

proposedChanges.value: Add 3-chip row below hero: 'Safe by default • Fully auditable • Reversible changes'
proposedChanges.rationale: Using chips to highlight key trust aspects immediately communicates core promises of safety and observability.
risks: Chips may be overlooked if not visually distinct enough

proposedChanges.value: Implement card style with soft edges, light shadows, and consistent padding for content grouping
proposedChanges.rationale: Soft edges and light shadows create a modern, premium look while consistent padding ensures readability and visual hierarchy.
risks: Cards may blend into the background if not sufficient contrast is provided

proposedChanges.value: Include audit log preview with icons and timestamps to indicate logging activity
proposedChanges.rationale: Providing a preview of logged actions with timestamps reinforces the transparency and accountability aspects of the service.
risks: Complexity in implementation may delay deployment

issues.description: Current hero copy could be more specific about what 'the system' means
issues.rationale: ambiguity - 'the system' may not immediately resonate with tired business owners

issues.description: Trust section could expand on 'Fully logged' to be more concrete
issues.rationale: weak_value_prop - logging benefit not clearly communicated

suggestedFixes.fix: Stop being the fallback for your website, forms, and updates. Hand it off. Keep visibility.
suggestedFixes.rationale: Makes 'the system' concrete with specific examples from whitepaper

suggestedFixes.fix: Safe by default. Every action logged. Everything reversible.
suggestedFixes.rationale: Parallel structure improves clarity and emphasizes accountability

assumptions: Business owners understand 'hand it off' implies ongoing service
Target audience values logging/reversibility as trust signals

swarm.reason: Missing craft or critic artifact for collapse
